why.title: Why this feature? (important read)
contents: Twitch already has a blocked terms feature, but it's very basic and cannot do complex filtering.
If you block the word <mark>twitchat</mark>, chatters can easily bypass this restriction by sending <mark>twit_chat</mark> or <mark>twitchüÖêt</mark> and many other alternatives.
Bots like Nightbot or Wizebot allow you to filter messages with complex rules via what's called Regular Expressions.
Twitchat's automod feature allows you to use Regular Expressions but also tries to make usage of alternative chars useless for bypassing automod rules.
Before applying a rule it will replace all alternative chars, including accented ones, by their latin equivalent.
For example, <mark>ùï•üÖ¶‚ìòùíïùì¨üÑ∑üá¶üáπ</mark> will be replaced by <mark>twitchat</mark> before applying automod rules on it.
Warning though, this process has its cost on performances and may slowdown twitchat a little if you receive lots of messages.

delete.title: Is deleting a message efficient against doxxing?
contents: No.
But it's the only way to moderate a message after it's sent.
The main problem is that extensions like BetterTTV allow users to keep deleted message.
If you want to avoid this, you'll have to configure a chat delay (see Chat Options). If a message is deleted during this time lapse, it won't be displayed anywhere, even for BTTV users.
Note that the message is still sent to everyone so it's technically possible to get it. Just more complicated.
The only safe way of filtering a message is when Twitch deletes it based on blocked terms before sending it to everyone. But as explained before, it's very limited :/

highlights.d:
1 year after the very first Twitchat version, the holy grail of the French community is here:
Twitchat exists in French ü•≥

Try changing the language üëá
Create as many chat columns as you want and choose which message types to display on each of them.
Choose which data and features of your Twitch account you want to allow Twitchat to use.
Create custom counters, update them from chat commands, subs, channel point rewards,... and show their progress on your stream.
Scrolling your chat, moving the read mark and moderate messages without touching your mouse has never been this easy thanks to the dials of the Stream Deck +
Sync emergency mode with shield mode. Enabling shield mode will enable emergency mode and vice versa.

Do you want to prevent people from talking in your chat when you're not live?

Twitchat can automatically switch to emote-only at the end of the stream and disable emote-only at the beginning of the live stream.

major.l: New message list. You can now create as many message lists as you want and choose which message types display on each with very fine granularity
Create custom counters, update their value from chat commands, channel point rewards, ... and show their progress on your stream
Dyslexic-friendly font added to the parameters
Emote-only: Automatically set your chat on emote-only when stopping your stream
Chat restrictions: At launch, a message will remind you if your chat has any restrictions (follow-only, sub-only, slow-mode,...)
Dont miss new messages even when reading old messages thanks to a live view of the 3 latest new messages at the bottom
Sync shield mode with the emergency button
You'll get notiffied when giving and receiving a shoutout

19 new triggers events:
  • when someone send a "presentation"
  • when the hype train can be started again
  • when giving a shoutout
  • when given a shoutout
  • when switching OBS scene
  • when showing/hiding an OBS source
  • when pinning/unpinning a message
  • when starting/stoping the shield mode
  • When stream is started
  • When stream is stoped
  • 5 Counters related triggers
  • When starting a raid

5 new trigger actions:
  • Update stream info
  • Update a counter
  • Read a counter
  • Generate a random value
  • Call an HTTP endpoint
4 new commands to add or remove time to a timer or a countdown /timeradd, /timerremove, /countdownadd, /countdownremove

minor.l: All commands can now be used from triggers
User list will show you the remaining timeout duration for every timed out users
You can start a bingo with any custom value
Messages blocked due to shared ban info and waiting for approval will now be displayed
When follow botted, all follow events will be merged into 1 single expandable notification
Start shield mode from the emergency button
Maximum raffle duration extended to 24h
Possibility to highlight partners' messages
BTTV/FFZ/7TV now displayed on emote selectors
Notify users if they try to use a cooling down chat command trigger
When TTS is reading messages, a button shows up to clear the whole TTS queue
Hype train conductors will now be displayed
Hype train summaries now show T1, T2 and T3 subs count seperatly
New /greetduration command to change the "auto delete after" duration of the greet them section
Removed Deezer integration after Deezer disabled that possibility
Every trigger type now has its own execution queue. You can create custom queues if you want to make sure 2 different trigger types execute sequentially instead of in paralel.

fixes.l: TTS for prediction result was  sometimes not saying the winning outcome label
Current music track info was not properly filled on triggers

gngngn.title: üò° Unacceptable üò°
contents: So, you're angry.
That's something I can understand.
May i share my point of view on this?
Twitchat is made by a single person (hello üëã)) and required at the very least 8 months of FULL TIME work to date (jan. 2022).
I'm allowing everyone to use it for free but it costs me money and a lot of time and efforts. I don't get ANY revenue from it besides very few donations (on which I pay 30% taxes).
I'm not sponsored by any company, I'm not gathering your personal info to sell them, and It's ad free (yes).
We're not talking about advertising here. I'm not advertising for products or whatever that would generate constant revenues.
I'm just sharing a link to Twitchat.
You can donate to disable it.
I'm not even asking for a specific amount. You can donate 1‚Ç¨ if you think my work isn't worth more than that, and you'll be able to disable that message.
And if you don't want to pay anything, Twitchat is open-source. You're free to create an instance for yourself.
For all these reasons, I don't think it's horrific to push a sporadic message on your chat and I see no good reason for you to be angry about that.
If you still think this automatic message is unacceptable, you're free to stop using Twitchat!
But, please, don't take free services for granted. They require a lots of time, efforts and knowledge to create.
I hope this makes things look less "evil" and that you understand my point of view :)
‚ù§ Have a nice stream ‚ù§
Best regards,
Durss
gngngn.why_info: Because it's the easiest and because, let's be honnest, if i was posting from another account you would ban it right away to block the message.
gngngn.angry: I already tell my viewers about Twitchat regularly, I don't like this intrusive message!
angry_contents: But I have no way to know about that.
Still, you can customize the message and everytime a link to "twitchat.fr" is sent on the chat (by any viewer, wizebot, nightbot, etc...) the timer is reset to 0.
This means that when telling about Twitchat to your viewers, if you send the link, the 2h timer will be reset.

head: Twitchat took MONTHS of my personnal time to create.
It's free for you to use but it costs me money, and I like eating (vegy) food.
If you can afford it, feel free to thank me and make my day brighter with one of the options bellow!

suggestion.title: Chat Suggestions
suggestion.alternative_tool: For a standalone tool with more options, check out {LINK}

timer.title: Timer & Countdown
timer.timer_head: You'll see the timer on the chat bar at the bottom of the screen. Stop it by clicking on it or via the command {CMD}.
timer.countdown_head: You'll see the countdown on the chat bar at the bottom of the screen. Stop it by clicking on it or via the command {CMD}.

alerts.title: Create your own alerts
alerts.info_1: With Twitchat you can create your own sub/follow/reward/poll/... alerts by controling your OBS sources and filters.
alerts.info_2: Add texts, images, videos or sounds on your OBS scene and let Twitchat control them when a specific event occurs. Twitchat can update text sources content with values like the subscriber's name.

streamdeck.title: Stream Deck‚Ñ¢ plugin
streamdeck.info_1: Twitchat can be controlled from your Stream Deck‚Ñ¢.
streamdeck.info_2: You can pause the chat, scroll it, mark messages as read, open poll/prediction/bingo/raffle state and much more with the push of a button.

obs_stop.title: Stop your stream on raid
obs_stop.info_1: Twitchat can automatically stop your OBS stream after you raided someone.

bingo.title: Create a bingo
bingo.info_1: You can create a bingo in which your viewers will have to be the first to guess a number, a global emote, or any custom word.

raffle.title: Create a raffle
raffle.info_1: You can create a raffle in which your viewers can enter by sending a command on chat.
raffle.info_2: You can then randomly pick one of them.
raffle.info_3: There's also an option to randomly pick one of your current subscribers/subgifters.

obs.title: Control OBS from chat
obs.info_1: Twitchat can change your current scene and mute/unmute your microphone from a chat command.
obs.info_2: If you forget to switch scene or unmute yourself, a mod can be there and do it for you as a backup.

api.title: Twitchat API
api.info_1: Did you know Twitchat exposes an API?
api.info_2: If you're a developer, you can control and get events from Twitchat.

music.title: Control music
music.info_2: This allows you to display the track currently playing on your stream as well as give your viewers control over the playback.
music.info_3: You can create your own song request system.

overlays.title: Twitchat overlays
overlays.info_1: Twitchat provides some overlays for your stream.
overlays.info_2: It can display your currently playing music, an animated wheel to pick a raffle's winner, a timer, a countdown or highlight a message of your viewers .

countdown.title: Timer and Countdown
countdown.info_1: You can start a timer or a coutdown with dedicated commands {CMD1} and {CMD2}

dock.title: Obs dock
dock.info_1: Did you know you can add Twitchat as an OBS Dock?

highlight.info_1: You want to show a viewer's message on your stream?
highlight.info_2: You can configure an OBS overlay or use a Twitchat Trigger to show it on your stream with a simple click on a button

userlist.infoBt: Why is the chat users count different from the viewer count?
infos: Chat user count shows people actually connected to your chat. Viewers count tells how many people are watching your stream.
It's possible to be on a chat without watching the stream (like bots) and it's possible to watch the stream without being on the chat (when watching from homepage or after closing the chat, ...)
Also, nothing's official, but it's almost certain that Twitch removes you from the viewers count if you keep the stream on a background tab for some time.
This usually makes your chatters count higher than your viewers count after a raid.
When promoted on homepage though, your viewer count will be MUCH higher than your chatters count.

why.title: Pourquoi cette fonctionnalit√© ? (important √† lire)
contents: Twitch a d√©j√† une fonctionnalit√© de "termes bloqu√©s", mais elle est tr√®s basique et ne permet pas un filtrage complexe.

Si vous bloquez le mot <mark>twitchat</mark>, les viewers peuvent facilement contourner cette restriction en √©crivant <mark>twit_chat</mark> ou <mark>twitchüÖêt</mark> et une infinit√© d'alternatives.
Des bots comme Nightbot ou Wizebot permettent de filtrer les messages avec des r√®gles plus complexes via ce que l'on appelle des Expressions r√©guli√®res.

La fonction automod de Twitchat' vous permet √©galement d'utiliser des expressions r√©guli√®res, mais tente √©galement de rendre l'utilisation de caract√®res alternatifs inefficace pour contourner les r√®gles de filtrage.
Avant d'appliquer une r√®gle, Twitchat remplacera tous les caract√®res alternatifs, y compris les caract√®res accentu√©s, par leur √©quivalent latin.
Par exemple, <mark>ùï•üÖ¶‚ìòùíïùì¨üÑ∑üá¶üáπ</mark> sera remplac√© par <mark>twitchat</mark> avant de lui appliquer les r√®gles de filtrage.
Attention Cependant, ce processus a un co√ªt sur les performances et peut ralentir un peu Twitchat si vous avez beaucoup de r√®gles et que vous recevez beaucoup de messages.

delete.title: La suppression d'un message est-elle efficace contre le doxxing* ?
contents: Non.
Mais c'est le seul moyen de mod√©rer un message apr√®s son envoi.
Le principal probl√®me est que des extensions comme BetterTTV permettent aux viewers de conserver les messages supprim√©s.

Si vous voulez √©viter cela, vous devrez configurer un d√©lai de chat (voir Options de chat). Si un message est supprim√© pendant ce laps de temps, il ne sera affich√© nulle part, m√™me pour les personnes utilisant BTTV.
Notez que le message est tout de m√™me envoy√© √† tout le monde, il reste donc techniquement possible de le consulter. Mais cela demande des connaissances en d√©veloppement.

Le seul moyen s√ªr de filtrer un message est de faire en sorte que Twitch le supprime avant de l'envoyer √† tout le monde. C'est ce que font les "termes bloqu√©s". Mais comme expliqu√© pr√©c√©demment, leur fonctionnement est tr√®s limit√© :/
*Le doxxing est l'acte de r√©v√©ler des donn√©es personnelles d'autrui publiquement.

gngngn.title: üò° Inacceptable üò°
contents: Tu es donc en col√®re.
Je peux le comprendre.
Puis-je te partager mon point de vue ?
Twitchat est cr√©√© par une seule personne (coucou üëã)) et a n√©cessit√© quasi 1 an de travail √† temps plein √† l'heure actuelle (jan. 2022).
J'offre ce travail √† tout le monde mais √ßa me co√ªte du temps, et de l'argent. A part quelques rares dons (sur lesquels je paye 30% de taxes) Twitchat ne me rapporte pas d'argent.
Je ne suis pas sponsoris√© par une marque, je ne collecte aucune donn√© personnelle, et je ne mets aucune publicit√©.
On ne parle pas r√©ellement de publicit√© ici. Je ne fais pas de pub pour des produits qui me rapporteraient de l'argent.
Je partage simplement un lien vers Twitchat.
Tu peux le d√©sactiver avec un don libre.
Tu peux m√™me ne donner qu'1‚Ç¨, si tu estime que mon travail ne m√©rite pas plus, et il te sera possible de d√©sactiver le message automatique.
Et si tu ne souhaite pas payer, Twitchat est open-source. Tu es libre de cr√©er ta propre instance.
Pour toutes ces raisons, je ne crois pas que ce soit si terrible d'avoir un lien post√© de temps en temps.
Si tu estimes tout de m√™me que c'est Inacceptable, libre √† toi de ne pas utiliser Twitchat !
Mais, s'il te plait, ne prends pas les services gratuits pour acquis. Ils demandent beaucoup de temps et de connaissances pour √™tre cr√©√©s.
J'esp√®re que les choses semblent moins scandaleuses et que tu comprends mon point de vue :)
‚ù§ Bons streams √† toi ‚ù§
Cordialement,
Durss
gngngn.why_info: Soyons honn√™tes, si je postais avec un autre compte tout le monde le bannirait dans la foul√©e pour ne pas avoir les message.
gngngn.angry: Je parle d√©j√† de Twitchat √† mes viewers, je n'aime pas ce message intrusif!
